contextArbitraryString.pl

00001 ####################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements a context in which the student's answer is treated as a
00004 #  literal string, and not parsed further.  The real answer checking
00005 #  should be performed in a custom checker passed to the answer
00006 #  string's cmp() method.  E.g.,
00007 #
00008 #        loadMacros("contextArbitraryString.pl");
00009 #        Context("ArbitraryString");
00010 #
00011 #        ANS(Compute("The string I want")->cmp(checker => sub {
00012 #          my ($correct,$student,$ans) = @_;
00013 #          $correct = $correct->value; # get perl string from String object
00014 #          $student = $student->value; # ditto
00015 #          ##
00016 #          ## do your checking here, and return true if correct
00017 #          ## or false if incorrect.  For example
00018 #          ##   return $correct eq $student;
00019 #          ##
00020 #          return $score;
00021 #        }));
00022 #
00023 
00024 sub _contextArbitraryString_init {
00025   my $context = $main::context{ArbitraryString} = Parser::Context->getCopy("Numeric");
00026   $context->{name} = "ArbitraryString";
00027   $context->parens->clear();
00028   $context->variables->clear();
00029   $context->constants->clear();
00030   $context->operators->clear();
00031   $context->functions->clear();
00032   $context->strings->clear();
00033   $context->{pattern}{number} = "^\$";
00034   $context->variables->{patterns} = {};
00035   $context->strings->{patterns}{".*"} = [-20,'str'];
00036   $context->{value}{"String()"} = "context::ArbitraryString";
00037   $context->{parser}{String} = "context::ArbitraryString::String";
00038   $context->update;
00039 }
00040 
00041 package context::ArbitraryString;
00042 sub new {shift; main::Compute(@_)}
00043 
00044 package context::ArbitraryString::String;
00045 our @ISA = ('Parser::String');
00046 
00047 sub new {
00048   my $self = shift;
00049   my ($equation,$value,$ref) = @_;
00050   $value = $equation->{string};
00051   $self->SUPER::new($equation,$value,$ref);
00052 }
